title: Node Test Executor
description: Runs tests using Node.js built-in test runner with TypeScript support and Jest compatibility

enableTsc.description: Whether to enable TypeScript compilation (if disabled, tests will run directly from source)

useTsx.description: Whether to use tsx instead of node for running TypeScript tests directly (recommended for most projects unless esbuild limitations require tsc)

enableJestCompat.description: Whether to enable Jest compatibility via node-test-jest-compat

imports.description: Additional modules to import before running tests

reporter.description: Test reporter to use (e.g., 'default', 'spec', 'tap', 'dot', or a path to a custom reporter)

useAlias.description: Whether to use tsc-alias to resolve path aliases

ignoreBuildErrors.description: Whether to ignore TypeScript build errors

additionalArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to the node test command

outputDir.description: Custom output directory for compiled tests. If not specified, defaults to dist/test-out/{projectName}

experimental.description: Whether to use experimental test features

testTimeout.description: Default timeout of a test in milliseconds

bail.description: Exit the test suite immediately after the first failing test

testNamePattern.description: Run only tests with the specified name

testPathPattern.description: Run only tests in files matching the specified pattern

maxWorkers.description: Maximum number of workers to use for running tests

parallel.description: Whether to run tests in parallel
